article.headline: Old Dominion 66, Md.-Eastern Shore 56
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. -- Gerald Lee scored 16 points to lift Old Dominion to a 66-56 win over Maryland-Eastern Shore on Monday night. The win was the sixth straight victory for the Monarchs (7-3). Lee also finished with nine rebounds and three blocked shots. Ben Finney added 14 points, eight rebounds and a season-high five steals. Neal Pitt paced the Hawks (1-7) with 19 points on 8 of 20 shooting. Keishawn Mayes chipped in with 14 points and 14 rebounds. The Hawks were outscored in the paint 34-18. Old Dominion also outrebounded the Hawks 44-34. The Monarchs shot only 21.4 percent from 3-point range (3-for-14), but scored 23 points off of the Hawks' 22 turnovers. They finished with 15 steals and 12 blocks as a team.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
